antiinvite.errorPerm: You need `Manage Server` permission to run this command!

firstField.title: What is Anti-invite?
firstField.value: Anti-invite is one of my automatic moderation modules, when someone sends an invitation link to a server other than this one and if that person doesn"t have any moderator permissions, this message will be deleted.

secondField.title: And how do I configure it?
secondField.value:
To configure the anti-invite module is very simple, just insert one of these options after the command: 
> `activate` › Activate the module
> `desactivate` › Deactivate the module
**But like me do i set up a channel where invites will be ignored? Just use one of the whitelist options below:**
> `whitelist add` › Add a channel to the list of channels that the bot will ignore invitesn> `whitelist remove` › Remove a channel from the list of channels the bot ignores

antiinvite.errorWhitleList:
You need to put what you want to do inside the whitelist subcommandn> `whitelist add` › Add a channel to the blocked channel list
> `whitelist remove › Remove a channel from the blocked channel list
antiinvite.channelAltereadySet: This channel is already on the whitelist
antiinvite.addedChannel: I successfully added the channel to the ignored channel list!
antiinvite.removeError: This channel is not on my whitelist so you can"t block it!
antiinvite.removed: I successfully removed the channel from the ignored channel list!

language.errorPerm: You need `Manage Server` permission to run this command!
language.message:
I see that you want to change the language I use here!**
> **To change it, just use the buttons in this message!
> **<:pt:965658002994651237> Portuguese › `100%`**
> **<:en:965658073203081257> English › `100%`**
> `The translations may not be 100% correct, if you find any problems with them, please report it to my team!`

prefix.errorPerm: You need `Manage Server` permission to run this command!
prefix.noPrefix: You need to enter the new prefix!
prefix.sevenLenght: The prefix cannot contain more than 7 characters!

welcome.errorPerm: You need `Manage Server` permission to run this command!
welcome.argsError:
**What is the welcome system?**
> The welcome system is a module that always sends a message automatically when someone enters the server.
**And how do I configure it?**
> For that this command has some subcommands:
> `{{prefix}}welcome status` › Toggles the system status between on and off
> `{{prefix}}welcome channel [channel]` › Choose the channel in which the message will be sent (use without the "[]")
> `{{prefix}}welcome message [message]` › Command used to choose the message that will be sent on the chosen channel (use without as "[]")
**We also have a small list of placeholders that you can place in the message to personalize it:**
> `{guild}` › Displays the server name
> `{membertag }` › Displays the name and tag of the member who joined
> `{member}` › Mentions the member who joined
> `{count}` › Shows the number of members the server has

autorole.errorPerm: You need `Manage Server` permission to run this command!

embed.name: What is autotole?
embed.value: Autorole is a module that **automatically** when a **member joins the server** they are given the **roles you chose**! (maximum 5)

embed.name: And how do I configure?
embed.value:
**To configure it, just use its sub-commands:**
<autorole status - Deactivate or Activate autorole.
<autorole role [role] - Add/Remove the position to the list of role (without the "[ ]").

autorole.enabled: System activated successfully, don"t forget to configure the roles!
autorole.invalidRole: You need to provide a valid role!
autorole.maxRoles: The server has reached the maximum of autorole roles, please remove one before adding another!
